p: GLs are known to produce an antidiabetic effect and, therefore, are used for the treatment of diabetes [ 86]. Treating diabetic rats with 200 mg/kg body weight (b.w.) GLs caused a reduction in the blood glucose levels and promoted oral glucose tolerance, which is essential to prevent weight loss as a consequence of impaired carbohydrate metabolism. With the improved activity of hexokinase and G6PDH, and reduced activity of gluconeogenic enzymes and glucose-6-phosphatase, the insulin levels stabilized [ 87]. Similar findings were reported by [ 82].
